ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version
e.g., ''Thinking of your entire lifetime'' or ''Since April 1, 2020''

ElementDescription: Since April 1, 2020, have you practiced social distancing? (i.e., reduced your physical contact with people outside of your home in social, work, or school settings by avoiding large groups and staying 3-6 feet away from other people when out in public)
Since April 1, 2020, how often have you practiced social distancing?
Notes: 1 = All the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Half the time; 4 = Less than half the time; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Since April 1, 2020, have you stayed at home as much as possible?

Since April 1, 2020, have you or someone in your household self-isolated or quarantined? (i.e., you separated yourself from other people, even those in your own household, to prevent others from getting sick)
Notes: 1 = No; 2 = Yes, myself only; 3 = Yes, someone else only; 4 = Yes, both myself and someone else; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Since April 1, 2020, have you or someone in your household cared for a dependent/dependents in your home? A dependent is anyone who relies on you for help with activities of daily living, including children under the age of 18 years, anyone over the age of 70 years, or someone with a chronic disease or disability.
Notes: 1 = No; 2 = Yes, myself only; 3 = Yes, someone else only; 4 = Yes, both myself and someone else; 99 = No answer
